sentences.en: All of Twain's books are molded from the clay of his past.
sentences.cn: 马克·吐温的全部作品,都是取材于自身的经历.

sentences.en: At the centre of book's success is Twain's appreciation of children.
sentences.cn: 本书获得成功的关键在于吐温能够理解儿童.

sentences.en: But Twain, Howells, and James were jeeringly described by Mencken as " draft - dodgers ".
sentences.cn: 不过吐温 、 豪威尔斯和詹姆斯都是被门肯讥诮地叫做 “ 逃避兵役的人. ”

sentences.en: East is East, and West is West, and never the twain shall meet.
sentences.cn: 东是东, 西是西, 故而两者永远不相遇.

sentences.en: families were either ‘church’ or ‘chapel’ and never the twain shall meet.
sentences.cn: 家庭要么是“教堂”，要么是“小礼拜堂”，只能为其一，不能兼而有之。

sentences.en: It is here that Twain's satirical vision darkens.
sentences.cn: 吐温那带有讽刺意味的眼光变得更加深沉了.

sentences.en: Mark Twain is a pseudonymity for Samuel Langhorne Clemens.
sentences.cn: 马克·吐温是萨缪尔·兰亨·克里曼斯的笔名.

sentences.en: Mark Twain was once a river pilot on the Mississippi.
sentences.cn: 马克·吐温曾当过密西西比河上的引航员.

sentences.en: The Russian student's familiarity with Mark Twain delighted him.
sentences.cn: 苏联学生对马克·吐温的熟悉程度使他大为惊喜.

sentences.en: The twain , lighting a latern, went out to the stable.
sentences.cn: 姐俩于是点起灯笼, 上了马棚.

sentences.en: The'Eastern'Mark Twain can be delicate to the point of prudery.
sentences.cn: “ 东部的 ” 马克·吐温竟可以严谨到一本正经的程度.

sentences.en: Then Mark Twain went to sleep.
sentences.cn: 然后,马克?吐温开始睡觉.

sentences.en: To my mind, Mark Twain was beyond question the large man of his time.
sentences.cn: 在我看来, 马克·吐温无疑是他那一时代中了不起的人物.

sentences.en: Twain himself seems to have inherited something of this attitude.
sentences.cn: 吐温似乎继承了这种秉性.

sentences.en: Twain is fierce enough with crooked Congressmen.
sentences.cn: 马克·吐温对于不正派的国会议员攻击甚力.

sentences.en: Twain's countrymen thought he had succeeded in each of these aims.
sentences.cn: 马克?吐温的同胞认为他已经达到了这些目标.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 马克·吐温（美国小说家）

trans.tran_cn: <古><诗>二，一对，（二者）水火不相容，永远不可能合到一起
